channel.title: Compiler -.-
channel.description:
Guys i'm using same compiler for the source & Client.
@ the source compiler Works fine but it isnt working @ client any help ?
when i try to compile it in my client folder it says: javac: file not found: src\server\event\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options
and as soon i click on ( - ) it closes.

item.title: Compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

What source and Client are you using?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay, I’ve seen this issue in the past.
This is going to sound weird, but make sure you downloaded the correct version of eclipse and jdk.
If you downloaded 32 bit jdk, make sure you downloaded the 32 bit version of eclipse.
If you downloaded 64 bit jdk, make sure you downloaded the 64 bit version of eclipse.

You may also need to set environmental variables.

Read full topic

can you give me a small tutorial how to use it ? thank you

Name of the variables : Path
modify PATH : C:\Windows\system32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem;C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0;C:\Program Files\B1 Free Archiver

Edit: Changed the Path to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin

I’m using ExtremeKO’s client & source.

it still isnt working any ideas?

item.title: Compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @elimination elimination
item.description:
@elimination wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:539007”]I can’t possibly wonder why a compiler tailored for a packaged source wouldn’t work on a client. Maybe because the client has no packaging, and that it has like 2 folders with java files.

@echo off title Building Files javac -d ./bin/ src/*.java src/sign/*.java title DONE pause
Make sure all your .java files are in a folder called “src” and then that in src there is a folder named “sign” and in said folder is signlink.java
Then make sure you have a “bin” folder in the same directory as the src folder (don’t put the bin folder in the src folder).
Lastly make sure your compiler is in the same directory as the other 2 folders.

@echo off Title Client cd ./bin/ START javaw -Xmx1024m client 30 0 highmem members 32 exit
There’s a run for your client as well.[/quote]

Ill try and post the result here thank you

Edit:

this is client.

@echo off
title Compiler
echo starting…
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_45/bin/javac” -cp lib/; -d bin -sourcepath src src/.java
@pause

@echo off
@title Client
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Dfile.encoding=Cp1252 -classpath bin;lib/libs.jar;lib/graphics.jar; Loader
pause

Server:
@title compile server
@echo off
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin\java.exe" -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -cp bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar com.rs.Launcher true true false
pause

@title start server
@echo off
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin\java.exe" -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -cp bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar com.rs.Launcher true true false
pause

I have Jdk version 6.39 / 7.45 / 7.51 thought maybe its cause of the Jdk but it isnt

i’ve been trying to fix it but it isnt working now my run/compiler for source & client isnt working can you teamview/skype the source & client please ? incase yes ? can you send me a private message with your skype in it.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I can’t possibly wonder why a compiler tailored for a packaged source wouldn’t work on a client. Maybe because the client has no packaging, and that it has like 2 folders with java files.

@echo off title Building Files javac -d ./bin/ src/*.java src/sign/*.java title DONE pause
Make sure all your .java files are in a folder called “src” and then that in src there is a folder named “sign” and in said folder is signlink.java
Then make sure you have a “bin” folder in the same directory as the src folder (don’t put the bin folder in the src folder).
Lastly make sure your compiler is in the same directory as the other 2 folders.

@echo off Title Client cd ./bin/ START javaw -Xmx1024m client 30 0 highmem members 32 exit
There’s a run for your client as well.

Read full topic
